Please bear in mind that Reddit is largely populated by information technology folks who have a very dim view of the humanities. The alternative perspective is this:

I have an English degree and no master[.]. I make about $80,000 and work from home. It[.] not a fortune, but my job is squarely in my field of study, and I love what I do. Many of the bad stats for english_major stem from the fact that the field attracts more than its fair share of aimless, low-aptitude students who are fearful of other fields and not particularly driven to excel at anything. If that[.] you, look elsewhere. If you're willing to fanatically pursue doing the work you love, you'll probably be fine.

That being said, look for a job that capitalizes on your being from Brunei, and don't move until you're hired. Translation may make your brain hurt or whatever, but the US is a very shitty place to be an unemployed immigrant with no familial safety net. You'll find that most institutions are nearly completely indifferent to your situation. You're having trouble getting a job? Tough. You can't afford health insurance? Tough. You don't have such-and-so immigration form to lease an apartment? Tough. "But where will I go?" "Not my problem."

All of these things can be accomplished, but they often require massive persistence and initiative on your part.
